website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy, inexpensive dual alto and tenor stand that’s great for the music studio.
pros: Padded to keep the horn from sliding around
Perfect fit for a tenor sax
cons: Doesn’t lock, so not recommended if you have kids or a lot of traffic around
A bit bulky for traveling or storing

customer_reviews.title: More stable than the Hercules, and 1/2 the price
customer_reviews.text: Much better, more stable, and less expensive than the Hercules. Doesn't wobble like the Hercules did. My kid almost pulled the Hercules stand over several times taking his alto sax out. The Hamilton is solid. I wish it folded up a little smaller for easier transport, but then again maybe that's why it is more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Lurchbird

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use even if you don't have an engineering degree.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job great. Only issue is they don't tell you that the smaller ring can be placed on the lower hole for a tenor sax configuration. It's very straight forward otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Dunkley

customer_reviews.title: A basic stand.  I kept it but ordered a grip type too.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine passive stand. Decent quality, and inexpensive. If you are leaving an expensive horn someplace other musicians may bump it, however, the locking versions are better. I reviewed one of those also. The Hercules DS630BB Auto Grip Alto/Tenor Saxophone Stand. More money, but the first time someone knocks your sax off this stand, you'll wish you'd sprung for the Hercules one.
customer_reviews.author: DocTodd

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if you play 2 instruments
customer_reviews.text: My daughter plays in 2 bands for school. She also plays Sax and Clarinet. I would get nervous when she placed her instruments on the ground during a concert. This base is great. I'm not nervous about her stepping on her instruments and breaking something off.
customer_reviews.author: MrsC

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really appreciates using this at home when she is practicing her clarinet and saxophone. Works just fine. Recommend using it with caution and would not leave instruments out on this stand in places where little kids are running around or where there is danger of either instrument getting knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: marvelous product and the price is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a marvelous product. I always wanted to put my flute and my alto sax to displace in my living room with my guitar. It is sturdy and the price is really good.
customer_reviews.author: jep

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, so I have no long term experience with it. But my first impressions are thus; it's stable, even on carpet. The pads are nice and soft which in turn keeps the horn from sliding around on it. (I have a Tenor Sax on it). If you need a more stable stand IMO you better buy one that bolts to the floor! Great price, great stand!
customer_reviews.author: jungmen

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It works...
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap, works ok. The bent rest piece in the middle is about as cheaply made and assembled as possible and it is right in the way of the guard for the lower tone holes, so when you pick up the sax, the stand comes with it sometimes. I would recommend this to people who don't really care. Great for students.
customer_reviews.author: dlk2528

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Stand for Alto Saxophone
customer_reviews.text: This stand works well for Alto. There is an extra peg for a Flute/Clarinet, but doesn't support Soprano Saxophone. -Sturdy and Balanced -Good for General Use [Have not used in travel] -Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.author: MunkyFu_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t walk around w this
customer_reviews.text: I used this sax/flute stand at one of my concerts! It works great easy to assemble, but I was getting up to go to my flute chair from the sax seat and the dang stand knocks of a MUSIC STAND in front of everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great product for any saxophone player
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stand for my brother's Christmas present. He absolutely loves it and says that works for his Alto sax. Easily foldable and doesn't take up too much space. Great product for any saxophone player
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: A Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: It's an very good item for the money. In my personal use there are only two drawbacks. I play recorder and sax and the recorder will not fit over the clarinet peg; and it would be helpful if the two pieces came with a small velcro binding strap to keep them together for traveling when disassembled for traveling. Otherwise, I am fully satisfied, especially because of the low price for a sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Schuyler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and feels sturdy with my alto. I've brought this to concerts and the legs fold up nicely; only a little bulkier to carry than my travel music stand. I feel a lot safer using this than leaving it on my chair during intermission.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and i feel secure in knowing my instrument is securely protected.
customer_reviews.author: Motownrick

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. It looks little cheaper. But it might match as cost performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny.N

customer_reviews.title: Good price, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good price, does the job. Many reviews say the instrument is not kept very stable, but that applies to any stand. The saxophone sits well on the stand and seems secure.
customer_reviews.author: Nadj

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: holds the alto or tenor ok. The peg doesn't hold the soprano or clarinet very well. Ehh. You horns may fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Tenor configuration explained
customer_reviews.text: Simple and straight forward. Comes configured for an alto sax. If using a tenor like me, will need to place the removable bracket on the lower hole. Seller would benefit from adding tenor configuration to product description.
customer_reviews.author: DRKNYHT

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this stand to anyone if you love your instrument😁 ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this stand to anyone if you love your instrument😁 I ordered this for my kid but I was always afraid of the instrument falling off this stand because it's not well made.Unfortunately I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was simple and quick.
customer_reviews.text: These stands are pretty sturdy. I wouldn't go on the road with them or anything, but I use it for my music studio. Assembly was simple and quick. Holds my alto well as well as my tenors. The clarinet stand is on an angle, so the horn doesn't stay straight, but it never falls.
customer_reviews.author: Randall C Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Great stand! My daughter loves it for her alto ...
customer_reviews.text: Great stand! My daughter loves it for her alto sax and shipping was very fast! She wanted her sax to be easy to get to so she can practice more because she's home schooled now. She said it looks cool and is a great compliment to her room.
customer_reviews.author: JANET L ELLIOTT

customer_reviews.title: My preference
customer_reviews.text: For a tenor sax, I prefer this stand over the Hercules because of the wider bell "jaw" & lighter weight, and better looks. Arguably, the Hercules would be preferred if the stand is in a high traffic area where it could get knocked. This seems identical to the "Stage Rocker" version, but that one seems to be permanently "out-of-stock".
customer_reviews.author: rjn

customer_reviews.title: works but a little different from the picture
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for a stand that can support a sax and a flute. it works but construction was a bit rough. the one i received, the flute peg was not at the rear of the sax holder but at the left of it. the weld didn't hold the flute stand straight up but was crooked a little. it doesn't fold up as neatly as the other more costly stands but as i was using it at home, this point doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth LEE WM

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this. Makes it very practical when I have to rest between training breaks.
customer_reviews.author: lui

customer_reviews.title: its a lil Flimsy but does what it suppose to do.
customer_reviews.text: It craddles my tenor sax and also holds my soprano perfectly .
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good stand overall. The stand came scratched and looked used. It does the job. I keep an alto saxophone and clarinet. Not too study if it was jostled around too much.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous100

customer_reviews.title: Is good!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this stand, I do wish it came with some sort of bag to carry it easier but i find some alternatives, I have much to no need for the clarinet bit of it but I keep it just case for any particular reason. This product is very sturdy and I use it in every practice I can fit it in.
customer_reviews.author: Luis D. Epix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, what else can I say?
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, what else can I say? Other than what a great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it is suppose to do. It holds my saxophone well.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect pair. Now it allows her to walk over ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a sax stand and she has a flute as well. This is the perfect pair. Now it allows her to walk over and pick up either instrument to play. Much easier than taking it out of the case to play = more practice time - happy mom.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen P.

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Saxophone Stand.
customer_reviews.text: I good quality stand for the Saxophone, and also a place to stand a Clarinet on it as well. It's sturdy and solid sitting on the floor. Opens easily and closes tightly for storage. A good price for a reliable stand.
customer_reviews.author: John Tremblay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Exactly as described. 100% Great buy. Thank You. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Clay Ledkins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use it for my alto sax and my clarinet, it holds the great. It's very sturdy. However, when it comes to traveling it's a bit inconvenient to have to unscrew the clarinet/flute holder. But still, HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maddox Larson

customer_reviews.title: This is a very stable stand. I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very stable stand. I have a cat and was worried that she would bump into it and knock it over, but she will rub against my alto and it stays put! I wish I had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: LoisGregerson

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy stand. Holds my son's Alto Saxophone & Clarinet very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason&Tara Goodin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand
customer_reviews.text: I like this stand so much,. The design is sturdy and seems durable. I widely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Joel MF

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: This stand is surprisingly good for the price. I use it for my tenor sax only, because the alto does not fit as well and seems a bit shaky. I also have a Hercules DS530B, which is a bit more expensive, but sturdier and better built, and the Hercules holds either the alto or tenor very well.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby-47

customer_reviews.title: This is a good seller.
customer_reviews.text: This is an economy stand. With careful placement of the sax in the stand, it should work well. It was fairly priced and arrived on time. This is a good seller.
customer_reviews.author: K Teel

customer_reviews.title: What a Showpiece and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My son was given a sax so I suggested using it for decor. This stand is basic, but does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: EyeLoveGlassesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great price great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I need it for! Sometimes I just want to play my sax! But if it's all cased up under my bed, out of site out of mind. Now I don't have to remember how wonderful it is to play my sax it's right there! You still want to keep it in a safe place. Every stand can be tipped over. I just wished it had another peg for more instruments. =) and I'm the husband writing this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Quality Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, quality stand that holds my tenor fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, holds your sax very in a very secure way and folds to a compact size you can fit mostly anywhere. The flute peg is removable and it's important to notice that this model can not be stored in the sax bell after folded. Good enough for any beginner to have at home.
customer_reviews.author: Al Chaves

customer_reviews.title: Love this stand!
customer_reviews.text: It always makes me nervous to leave my sax sitting on a chair, so I figured for the price, I had nothing to lose buying this stand. It's great. It folds up nicely into my music bag, and is easy to set up. My sax feels secure on the stand. I haven't used the flute peg yet, but when I do I will post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stand and the additional peg is a perfect addition for a doubler.
customer_reviews.author: Karelia

customer_reviews.title: May be a little fear because it doesnt look secure but i tested it out and i dont feel like ill have any problems with it
customer_reviews.text: Makes my life easier and does exactly what its supposed to do. May be a little fear because it doesnt look secure but i tested it out and i dont feel like ill have any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: It arrived quickly and in good shape.
customer_reviews.text: Always use this when playing or practicing. Very durable and steady. It arrived quickly and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Rich N.

customer_reviews.title: Will scratch the bottom of a tenor sax
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of a tenor sax sits too low and will scratch against the base of the stand
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Nebres

customer_reviews.title: Its a saxophone stand
customer_reviews.text: Its a saxophone stand. What more needs to be explained? Either it works or falls apart I guess. This one like all the others I have bought in my career works just fine. Its kind of a difficult thing to screw up but 5 stars anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Guy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great when i have to play my clarinet and sax at gigs. Very sturdy and easy to assemble. Liked it so much I got one for my music room.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Stand for Alto Sax and Clarinet
customer_reviews.text: This stand is excellent for my Alto Sax and Clarinet. Instruments perfectly fits the places on the stand. Low price is also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: FLRNrs

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely functional. I would caution you that if ...
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely functional. I would caution you that if it is shaken around even moderately, your saxophone might fall. To remedy this, I keep a small bungie cord in my saxophone case to keep it secured to the stand when I am not using it.
customer_reviews.author: TyPhoonMarlo

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: arrived very quickly, works like a charm, very happy with it I will be glad to order again from this supplier
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand to hold my hubby's sax
customer_reviews.text: Got this stand to keep my husband's sax out so he can easily pick up and practice at any time. It's nice to have it out and the sax looks really nice on display in between practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Shezcarl

customer_reviews.title: Works well but somehow the folding of the legs doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but somehow the folding of the legs doesn't make it easier for storage. guess that's not the intention...
customer_reviews.author: chtnwmw

customer_reviews.title: Well worth
customer_reviews.text: Using it only for Saxophone so far. Very happy with the purchase. Lot of time saving as compared to taking the instrument out from the box each time, assembling and putting it back after playing.
customer_reviews.author: home user

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My Alto Sax seats very snug and secure on this stand. The stand is very sturdy and folds up nicely for travel. I need to get a Clarinet now so I can use it completely. LoL
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: It's probably fine for Alto Saxophones but it seems a little "wobbly" ...
customer_reviews.text: It's probably fine for Alto Saxophones but it seems a little "wobbly" for my tenor. Good price, I'll keep it but I'm a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dw323

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should and folds nicely for transport. Keeps your sax and flute safe and ready for play.
customer_reviews.author: DEF

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton alto stand
customer_reviews.text: Stand works as described. I don't use the soprano peg and just unscrewed it. Is sturdy. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: retiringtoNH

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Very stable. You would have to hit it pretty hard for it to fall over.
customer_reviews.author: SRG

customer_reviews.title: Holds my C Melody saxophone well for a display. ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds my C Melody saxophone well for a display. The only thing I would add would be a strap across the top.
customer_reviews.author: Superjagunda

customer_reviews.title: Took me a while to figure out how to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to figure out how to use the thing. It works but doesn't stop the sax from moving from side to side.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, very sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: Great stand, very sturdy and stable. I like that it stays balanced when only a clarinet is on the stand. Great for resting your saxophone without risk of scraping the metal
customer_reviews.author: Amber G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, practical stand for my alto and clarinet. Love it and a great value!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Silva

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended. 4 stars because the clarinet peg ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. 4 stars because the clarinet peg stands at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: Andante60

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mult-instrument stand.
customer_reviews.text: This was a very inexpensive stand and is great for teaching a woodwind class and having to switch between instruments a lot for demonstration. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Great Alto Sax Stand
customer_reviews.text: It hold the sax quite nicely, it's sturdy, lightweight and gives a professional look. Keeps sax ready whenever my son decides to play that allows him to play it more often instead of packing/unpacking sax into/from its case.
customer_reviews.author: Koalacpa

customer_reviews.title: Sax Stand
customer_reviews.text: Its a sax stand. It is strong. It holds my sax safely. Easy folding legs for gigs and travel. Couldn't ask more of it.
customer_reviews.author: sugarray

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter when she transitioned from clarinet to sax. It securely holds both instruments easily. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No problem purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Received stand and it was simple to assemble. Works fine. Good construction for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bitar

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pack and very sturdy. Need another one as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Claudy J. Philemon

customer_reviews.title: Enough for beginners
customer_reviews.text: With a comfortable price that doesn't ruin your budget this is really good investment for beginners!Thank you for the product like that!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Bares

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great stand. I like the flute peg. I have both a tenor/alto sax and a flute...
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Gideon

customer_reviews.title: the Sax can be easily knocked off the stand (e
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the Sax can be easily knocked off the stand (e.g. by small children)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I got it for my son's student sax. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my son's student sax. It does the job of storing/holding the sax(at home). But if my son had an expensive sax, I wouldn't feel very safe using this stand.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Works better than others we have used
customer_reviews.text: Works great...took a bit to figure out how it worked, but once we did served us very well.
customer_reviews.author: JayR101

customer_reviews.title: and is beautiful to look at
customer_reviews.text: Puts saxophone in immediate reach, and is beautiful to look at. Holds the saxophone well and is sturdily built
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hold my alto just fine. With it had an option for a second peg.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Item was received in new condition and is a great item for my Grand daughter to use during band ...
customer_reviews.text: Item was received in new condition and is a great item for my Grand daughter to use during band and practice to take care of her Sax.
customer_reviews.author: sfofficer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand for both Sax and Flute
customer_reviews.text: This is nice because my daughter can now just carry one stand when she travels, and flute and sax are a common combo because of the similar fingerings. Appears nicely built and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pilla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this item. Thinking about ordering another soon.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Baker

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This item was received promptly. Good quality and this will work out great for my dual instruments! Would order again...
customer_reviews.author: Gini

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be ale to display my sax in my music room, and also have it ready to pick-up and play whenever instead of stored away in its case. I also have a flute so this easily lets me have both instruments out. I have not been able to figure out how to adjust the flute peg, or even figure out whether it is adjustable or not. The flute sticks out at an odd angle which limits placement of the stand in the music room. But at least the sax looks nice on it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: I bought three of them one for the alto sax ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of them one for the alto sax one for the tenor and one for the soprano sax which doesn't fit the sax well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great help for a woodwind player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stand for my 11-your-old son who is a beginner clarinet and Tenor saxophone player. As he started practicing moire consistently, we found it to be very uncomfortable to keep assmbling and dis-assembling his instruments. This inexpensive and practical stand makes home practice so much easier. The stand is steady, does not wobble and does not take a lot of room so it fits our music room very well. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia St. Jules

customer_reviews.title: hamilton stand
customer_reviews.text: very inexpensive great product. Hold alto saxophone and clarinet on carpet without tipping over yet. Light weight and easy to carry
customer_reviews.author: halloween ghoul

customer_reviews.title: Not for live gig
customer_reviews.text: As with other reviews I have read, I agree that this stand will be useful if your saxes are in a room without the chance of someone knocking into them. As for a live gig scenario, I decided to try. The saxes survived, but I was constantly concerned that if they were knocked into they would topple. For the money, the design and manufacturing is adequate. I would suggest spending a few more dollars for a sturdier set up. If you have horns that are worth anything, I'd look elsewhere. If this stand is solely used in a room with no animals or children to knock over - you'd be ok.
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah2911

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand.
customer_reviews.text: From day one our son has really liked this stand. Well made and compact. Only wish that it came with a travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and very sturdy. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CindyAZ

customer_reviews.title: Works for my son
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a stand for my son to practice over the summer and it works great. It doesn't stay great on hard wood floor but fine with carpet. He has not complained and has practiced so it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Sunil Majethia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Sturdy and supports a tenor sax very well.
customer_reviews.author: DMLR

customer_reviews.title: Sax Stand
customer_reviews.text: The cost was reasonable. It is worth the price and makes storing of my instruments very convenient. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore P. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great to get you playing again
customer_reviews.text: This streams works very well. Leaving the saxophone out by my desk is really great for those moments I just want to noodle around workout worrying about setup.
customer_reviews.author: J. Regier

customer_reviews.title: very happy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep our son's saxophone setup in the living room. It is attractive and sturdy and he practices sooo much more because it is easily accessible. Very satisfied!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Finnick

customer_reviews.title: I use it for several different vintage tenors and they fit nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Well built but not too heavy. I use it for several different vintage tenors and they fit nicely.
customer_reviews.author: mark steinke

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very useful if you have a student playing clarinet & sax - wish I found this before getting the clarinet stand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Stand for Alto Sax
customer_reviews.text: The Stand is of very good quality and is very stable to hold an Alto Saxophone.
customer_reviews.author: SBalli

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and excellent
customer_reviews.text: This item is wonderful stand. You can take off the flute/clarinet peg if you don't want. Don't hesitate buy this item and just get it. I recommend this item if you are looking for the leg for Alto/Tenor saxphone stand.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: good stand
customer_reviews.text: nothing wrong with this stand, I've owned many. only issue is the pieces that hold the legs out when picked up, do eventually wear out. I've owned a bunch of these. also, the little buttons on the ends of the curved pieces can fall off and scratch the horn if one isn't gentle in handling it. ie: tossing it into drum bags between gigs or fending off biting dogs....haha...
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Alto/Tenor Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand was excellent! Well-priced, solidly built, easy to assemble and disassemble, and definitely strong enough to hold a tenor. The flute/clarinet peg can also be used to hold a soprano saxophone. I was very pleased with it overall and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Buckley

product_meta.title: Hamilton Alto/Tenor sax Stand, Black, includes Flute/Clarinet peg
product_meta.description: For 130 years Hamilton Stands has been synonymous with quality and durability and is one of the oldest music products companies in the US.
feature_bullets: Center support tube can be easily removed for the most compact size for travel and storage
Fits in most gig bags and back packs
Metric receiver will accept other doubling pegs
Warranty: Three Years - Against defects in materials and workmanship

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars357 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
